recipes.name: Gobi Manchurian in Gravy
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, cut into florets
½ teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder
1 cup chopped spring onions, whites and greens separated
½ cup finely chopped green bell pepper (capsicum)
½ tablespoon green chili sauce or spicy red chili sauce
directions: Step 1: Blanch the cauliflower: In a pot, heat enough water to cover the cauliflower florets. Add salt and bring to a boil. Add the cauliflower florets and blanch for 10-15 minutes until slightly tender. Drain and set aside.

Step 2: Prepare the batter: In a bowl, combine all-purpose flour, cornstarch, soy sauce, black pepper, Kashmiri red chili powder, and salt. Add water gradually and whisk until a smooth batter forms, ensuring no lumps.

Step 3: Fry the cauliflower: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat. Dip each cauliflower floret in the batter and fry until golden brown and crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels. You can deep fry or shallow fry, adjusting oil quantity accordingly. Fry in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.

Step 4: Prepare the sauce: In the same wok, add a little more oil if needed. Sauté ginger, garlic, and green chilies for a few seconds until fragrant. Add spring onion whites, green bell pepper, and celery (if using). Stir-fry until slightly softened.

Step 5: Combine and simmer: Add soy sauce, tomato ketchup, black pepper, and salt. Stir well. Add the fried cauliflower florets, ensuring they are well coated in the sauce. Add water and bring to a boil.

Step 6: Thicken the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining cornstarch and water until smooth. Pour into the simmering sauce, stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Simmer for a few minutes until the sauce thickens.
Step 7: Final seasoning: Add sugar and rice vinegar. Adjust salt and other seasonings to taste.
Step 8: Serve: Garnish with chopped spring onion greens and serve hot with steamed rice, fried rice, or noodles.

recipes.name: Korean Fried Chicken (Yangnyeom Chicken)
ingredients: Cooking oil for deep frying (e.g., rice bran oil)
1/2 tbsp gochujang (Korean chili paste, optional, for extra spice)
Green onion, finely chopped or thinly shredded, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, rice wine, ginger, salt, and pepper. Mix well and ensure the chicken is evenly coated. Then, coat the chicken thoroughly with the potato starch or cornstarch and set aside.

Step 2: First Fry: Heat a generous amount of cooking oil in a deep saucepan or fryer to 175°C (347°F). Carefully add the chicken to the hot oil, avoiding overcrowding. Fry for 3-5 minutes, depending on the size of the chicken pieces, until lightly cooked. Remove the chicken and place it on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain.

Step 3: Second Fry: Once all the chicken has been through the first fry, remove any floating debris from the oil. Heat the oil back to 175°C (347°F). Fry the chicken again for 2-3 minutes, until golden brown and crispy. Remove and set aside.

Step 4: Make the Sauce: While the chicken fries, combine the tomato sauce, gochujang, honey, brown sugar, soy sauce, garlic, and sesame oil in a separate saucepan. Heat over medium-low, stirring constantly, until the sauce bubbles. Remove from heat.
Step 5: Coat the Chicken: Place the twice-fried chicken in a large bowl. Pour the sauce over the chicken and toss gently to coat evenly. Alternatively, serve the sauce on the side for dipping.
Step 6: Serve: Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and chopped green onions. Serve the Korean Fried Chicken hot immediately.

cooking_tips: For extra crispy chicken, use potato starch instead of cornstarch.
Don't overcrowd the pan when frying, as this will lower the oil temperature and result in soggy chicken.
Adjust the amount of gochujang to control the spiciness level.
If you prefer a sticky glaze, simmer the sauce for a longer time to thicken it.

recipes.name: Kimchi Sweet Potato Fries with Curry Fry Sauce
ingredients: 1 large sweet potato, cut into 1/2-inch wedges
1/2 cup Curry Fry Sauce (see recipe or use store-bought)
1/2 cup shredded mozzarella, cheddar, or Monterey Jack cheese
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C).
Step 2: In a medium bowl, toss the sweet potato wedges with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
Step 3: Spread the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Step 4: Bake for 15 minutes on the middle rack, then flip the potatoes and bake for another 5-10 minutes, or until tender and slightly crispy.
Step 5: Divide the fries among serving bowls.
Step 6: Top with shredded cheese, chopped kimchi, and Curry Fry Sauce.
Step 7: Garnish with cilantro, green onions, and parsley.
Step 8: Serve immediately with a fork.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Salmon Stir-Fry with Wasabi Fried Rice
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the teriyaki sauce, lime zest, and 1 teaspoon of wasabi powder. Add the salmon fillets, turning to coat them evenly. Marinate for 10 minutes.
Step 2: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Cook the salmon for 2 minutes per side, or until crisp, sticky, and cooked through.
Step 3: Remove the salmon from the pan and flake into large chunks. Set aside.
Step 4: Pour the leftover marinade into the pan. Add the stir-fry vegetables and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until they begin to soften.
Step 5: In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 teaspoons of wasabi powder, lime juice, and soy sauce. Add this mixture to the pan along with the cooked basmati rice. Stir to combine.
Step 6: Once the rice is heated through, gently fold in the flaked salmon and chopped coriander. Serve immediately.

Garnish with fresh coriander sprigs and lime wedges. Employ soft, directional lighting for a bright, inviting mood, shooting from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the dish's entirety.

recipes.name: Country-Fried Steak with Cream Gravy
ingredients: 3 lbs beef round steak, trimmed and cut into 6-8 pieces
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Steaks: Pound the trimmed steak pieces until thin.
Step 2: Combine Ingredients: In a shallow bowl, whisk together the evaporated milk, Tabasco sauce, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.

Step 3: Prepare Flour Stations: Place 1 cup of all-purpose flour in a separate shallow dish. In a third dish, combine the remaining 1 cup of flour, paprika, garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of salt, and black pepper.

Step 4: Coat the Steaks: Dredge each steak piece in the plain flour, then dip in the milk mixture, ensuring it's fully coated. Finally, dredge the steak in the seasoned flour mixture, pressing lightly to adhere.
Step 5: Set Aside: Place the coated steaks on a wire rack or plate while you heat the oil.

Step 6: Fry the Steaks: Heat 1-2 inches of vegetable oil in a large, heavy skillet (cast iron is recommended) over medium-high heat. Once hot, carefully place the steaks in the hot oil, ensuring not to overcrowd the pan.

Step 7: Cook and Drain: Fry the steaks for approximately 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through. Remove the steaks from the skillet and place them on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.

Step 8: Make the Cream Gravy (Optional): Pour off all but about 6 tablespoons of the fat from the skillet. Whisk in 6 tablespoons of the seasoned flour mixture until smooth. Gradually whisk in 2 1/2 cups of milk, stirring constantly until the gravy thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 9: Serve: Serve the country-fried steaks hot, smothered with cream gravy (if desired). Mashed potatoes and biscuits are traditional accompaniments.

Employ warm, natural lighting to enhance the rich browns and creamy whites.  Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh black pepper and a sprig of parsley against a rustic wooden backdrop. scenes.voice_over: Heat about an inch of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Carefully place the steaks in the hot oil, don't overcrowd the pan. Fry for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: Fried steaks resting on a wire rack with paper towels beneath, draining excess oil.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooked, remove the steaks and place them on a wire rack to drain any excess oil.

scenes.voice_over: Now for the gravy: In the same skillet, whisk in some seasoned flour with the leftover oil to create a roux.  Gradually whisk in milk until the gravy thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

cooking_tips: Use a meat mallet to pound the steaks evenly and quickly.

recipes.name: No-Fry Fried Ice Cream
directions: Step 1: Scoop 8 balls of vanilla ice cream and place them on a wax-lined cookie sheet. Freeze for at least 1 hour.
Step 2: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 3: In a medium bowl, combine the crushed corn flakes, melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon.
Step 4: Spread the cornflake mixture on a separate baking sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Stir occasionally to ensure even browning. Let cool completely.
Step 5: Remove the ice cream balls from the freezer. Roll each ice cream ball in the cooled cornflake mixture, ensuring it's fully coated.
Step 6: Return the coated ice cream balls to the freezer for at least 2 hours to firm up.
Step 7: Drizzle with honey before serving.

A shallow depth of field focuses on the textured, golden crust and melting ice cream.  Soft, directional light from the side highlights the honey drizzle and a sprinkle of cinnamon. Use a dark, moody background to create contrast. Garnish with a few whole cornflakes and a small sprig of mint. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle to showcase both the topping and the melting ice cream.  Emphasize the cold, creamy texture contrasting with the warm, crispy coating.

recipes.name: Crispy Fried Chicken and Chili Garlic Kale Salad
ingredients: 2 large heads curly green kale, destemmed and shredded
directions: Step 1: Marinate the chicken: Several hours or up to overnight, place the chicken thighs in a baking dish and cover with 2 cups of buttermilk. Flip to coat evenly and occasionally flip to ensure even marination.

Step 2: Prepare the kale salad: Remove the thick stems from the kale leaves and shred the leaves. Place the shredded kale in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, sesame oil, balsamic vinegar, chili garlic paste, and honey. Pour the dressing over the kale and massage it with your hands for 5 minutes. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Step 3: Prepare for frying: Heat about 4 inches of vegetable oil in a large pot fitted with a candy thermometer over medium heat. The oil should reach 350°F (175°C). Divide the flour into two bowls (2 cups each). In one bowl, combine half of the salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. Set up a third bowl with the remaining buttermilk.

Step 4: Fry the chicken: Once the oil is hot, take a piece of marinated chicken and dredge it in the seasoned flour. Dip it in the buttermilk, then dredge it in the second bowl of plain flour, ensuring a thorough coating. Carefully place the chicken in the hot oil, frying 1-2 pieces at a time for about 8-10 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through. Flip the chicken once or twice during frying. Remove the fried chicken and place it on a wire rack set over a paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain excess oil.
Step 5: Assemble the salad: Just before serving, toss the kale salad with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts. Slice the fried chicken and arrange it over the kale salad.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy fried chicken thighs atop a vibrant chili garlic kale salad.  Use dark wood background and linen napkins.  Style the salad with glistening kale, chopped peanuts, and a drizzle of honey.  Focus on the crispy chicken texture and the vibrant green kale.  Shallow depth of field, highlighting the chicken in the foreground.  Natural, bright lighting with soft shadows.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle to showcase both the chicken and the salad's texture. Aim for a rustic yet modern mood.

video_script.title: Crispy Fried Chicken & Chili Garlic Kale Salad

scenes.text: Crispy Fried Chicken & Chili Garlic Kale Salad
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a delicious and healthy meal: crispy fried chicken paired with a chili garlic kale salad. This recipe is perfect for a weeknight dinner or a weekend feast.

scenes.image_prompt: Show all ingredients for the recipe neatly arranged on a wooden table. Group related ingredients: kale, olive oil, sesame oil, balsamic vinegar, chili garlic paste, honey, peanuts for the salad. Chicken thighs, buttermilk, flour, spices for the chicken. Vegetable oil for frying.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need for this recipe. For the salad, we have fresh kale, olive oil, sesame oil, balsamic vinegar, chili garlic paste, honey, and peanuts. For the chicken, we have boneless, skinless chicken thighs, buttermilk, flour, salt, pepper, smoked paprika, and garlic powder. And of course, we'll need vegetable oil for frying.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken thighs marinating in buttermilk in a glass dish.  Focus on the chicken being submerged in the buttermilk.
scenes.voice_over: First, marinate the chicken thighs in buttermilk for at least a few hours, or preferably overnight. This helps tenderize the chicken and ensures it stays juicy when fried.  Make sure the chicken is fully coated in the buttermilk.

scenes.image_prompt: Hands massaging kale with dressing in a large bowl.
scenes.voice_over: While the chicken marinates, prepare the kale salad.  Destem and shred the kale, then massage it with a mixture of olive oil, sesame oil, balsamic vinegar, chili garlic paste, and honey.  This helps to soften the kale and make it more palatable. Refrigerate until you're ready to serve.

scenes.image_prompt: A pot of vegetable oil heating on a stove with a candy thermometer showing 350°F (175°C). Three bowls, one with seasoned flour, one with plain flour, and one with buttermilk.
scenes.voice_over: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot to 350°F (175°C). Use a candy thermometer to ensure the oil reaches the correct temperature. Prepare three bowls: one with seasoned flour, one with plain flour, and one with the remaining buttermilk. This sets up our dredging station.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken being dredged in flour, then buttermilk, then flour again. Close-up shot of the process to show the even coating.
scenes.voice_over: Dredge each chicken thigh in the seasoned flour, then dip it in the buttermilk, and finally, dredge it again in the plain flour. This double dredging creates a wonderfully crispy crust. Carefully place the chicken in the hot oil, frying in batches for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown and cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: Fried chicken pieces placed on a wire rack over a paper towel-lined baking sheet, allowing excess oil to drip off.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooked, remove the chicken from the oil and place it on a wire rack set over a paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain excess oil. This helps maintain that crispy exterior.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of tossing the kale salad with salt, pepper, and chopped peanuts just before serving.
scenes.voice_over: Just before serving, season the kale salad with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with chopped peanuts. This adds a nice crunch and salty flavor to the salad.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced fried chicken arranged beautifully over a bed of the finished kale salad.  Close-up shot emphasizing the textures and colors of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Slice the fried chicken and arrange it over the prepared kale salad.  This dish is packed with flavor and nutrients. Each serving has approximately 500-600 calories, 40-50 grams of protein, 20-30 grams of carbs, and 30-40 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy chicken, add a few drops of buttermilk to the flour while dredging.
Marinate the chicken for longer for more flavorful and tender results.
Don't overcrowd the pot while frying, as this will lower the oil temperature and result in soggy chicken.

recipes.name: Crispy Fried Four-Cheese Ravioli with Marinara Sauce
ingredients: 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, plus extra for garnish

directions: Step 1: Prepare the Breading Station: In a shallow dish, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. In a second shallow dish, whisk together the eggs and milk. In a third shallow dish, combine the breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese.

Focus sharply on the golden-brown, textured ravioli closest to the camera, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background. Use warm, directional lighting to highlight the cheesy filling oozing from a broken ravioli and the steam rising from the sauce.  Garnish with fresh basil and a sprinkle of Parmesan.  Background should be a dark, rustic wood surface with a linen napkin casually draped nearby. Mood: inviting, comforting, and decadent.

scenes.voice_over: Heat about 4 cups of vegetable oil in a large pot or deep fryer to 375°F (190°C). Use a thermometer to ensure the oil reaches the correct temperature.

scenes.image_prompt: Ravioli being carefully placed into the hot oil using tongs. Show some ravioli already frying and turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Carefully place the breaded ravioli into the hot oil in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pot. Fry for about 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy.

scenes.image_prompt: Fried ravioli being removed from the oil with tongs and placed on a wire rack or plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooked, remove the ravioli with tongs and place them on a wire rack or a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a plate of finished crispy fried ravioli, garnished with fresh basil and grated parmesan. A small bowl of marinara sauce is placed next to the plate, ready for dipping.
scenes.voice_over: Serve the crispy fried ravioli immediately with a side of warm marinara sauce for dipping. Garnish with fresh basil and extra grated Parmesan cheese, if desired. Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the finished dish with serving suggestions like a fresh salad, a glass of wine, or other appetizers. The lighting should be warm and inviting.
scenes.voice_over: These crispy ravioli make a fantastic appetizer or snack. Pair them with a fresh salad, a glass of wine, or your favorite dipping sauces for a complete meal.

cooking_tips: Use a thermometer to maintain the oil temperature at 375°F for consistent frying.
Fry the ravioli in batches to avoid overcrowding the pot and ensure even cooking.
Keep the fried ravioli warm in a 250°F oven while you finish frying the remaining batches.

recipes.name: Spicy Noodle Fries
ingredients: 1 large package (instant) spicy fire noodles (includes dried noodles, flakes, and spicy liquid sauce)
Vegetable oil (such as rice bran oil), for deep frying
directions: Step 1: Heat the vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to the temperature recommended on the french fry package instructions. Deep fry the french fries until golden brown and crispy. Remove and transfer to a large mixing bowl.
Step 2: While the fries are frying, cook the noodles according to package directions. Typically, boil water in a separate pot, add noodles, and cook for 40-50 seconds, stirring occasionally.

Step 3: Remove the cooked noodles using a sieve or tongs and shake off excess water. Carefully deep fry the noodles in the same oil as the fries for about 1 minute, or until crispy.  A frying basket is helpful for this step.
Step 4: Transfer the crispy noodles to the bowl with the french fries. Carefully break the noodles into bite-sized pieces.
Step 5: Add the flake seasoning and spicy liquid sauce from the noodle package to the fries and noodles. Start with a small amount of spicy sauce and add more to taste.
Step 6: Gently toss the fries and noodles to coat evenly with the sauce and seasonings.
Step 7: Transfer the Noodle Fries back to the noodle cup. Garnish with extra seaweed and sesame seeds. Add more spicy sauce to taste and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture Spicy Noodle Fries: crispy golden fries intertwined with vibrant red fire noodles, garnished with crumbled seaweed and toasted sesame seeds.  Use a dark, textured background and moody lighting. Focus sharply on the noodles and fries in the foreground, creating a shallow depth of field. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing the texture and steam rising from the dish.  Emphasize the glossy sauce and include subtle reflections on the plate's surface.

scenes.voice_over: While the fries are frying, cook your noodles according to package directions. Usually, boil water, add noodles, and cook for about 40-50 seconds until they are soft.

scenes.voice_over: Now fry the cooked noodles in the same oil for about a minute until they get nice and crispy.

scenes.voice_over: Transfer the Noodle Fries back to the noodle cup. Garnish with extra seaweed and sesame seeds. Add more spicy sauce if you like it extra hot.

cooking_tips: Adjust the amount of spicy sauce to your preference.
For a healthier option, bake or air fry the french fries instead of deep-frying.
Crushing the seaweed with your hands helps release its flavor and makes it easier to distribute evenly.

recipes.name: Pork Stir-fry with Jasmine Rice
ingredients: 125g snow peas, trimmed and halved diagonally
190g jar Thai chili jam stir-fry paste
directions: Step 1: Rinse the rice under cold water in a sieve.
Step 2: In a large saucepan, bring 3 cups of water to a boil over medium heat.
Step 3: Add the rinsed rice to the boiling water, cover tightly, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Step 4: Turn off the heat and let the rice stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Step 5: While the rice is cooking, heat a wok over high heat until hot.
Step 6: Add 1 teaspoon of olive oil to the wok and swirl to coat.
Step 7: Add one-third of the pork strips to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute, or until browned.
Step 8: Remove the browned pork from the wok and set aside on a plate. Repeat this process twice with the remaining pork and 1 teaspoon of oil for each batch.
Step 9: Add the remaining 1 teaspoon of olive oil and the thinly wedged onion to the wok. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Step 10: Add the snow peas to the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 11: Return the cooked pork to the wok. Add the drained baby corn spears and the Thai chili jam stir-fry paste.
Step 12: Stir-fry for 2 minutes, or until heated through.
Step 13: Serve the pork stir-fry hot over the cooked jasmine rice.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, overhead shot of pork stir-fry with jasmine rice.  Use soft, directional light to highlight the glistening pork and colorful vegetables.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the pork, with the rice softly blurred.  Style with rustic wooden chopsticks and a dark slate background. Garnish with chopped cilantro and toasted sesame seeds.  Compose the stir-fry over a bed of fluffy jasmine rice, showcasing the texture and color contrast. Aim for a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Pork Stir-fry with Jasmine Rice
video_script.description: A quick and easy weeknight meal packed with flavor! This pork stir-fry with jasmine rice is a delicious and satisfying dish that's ready in under 30 minutes.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: jasmine rice, pork stir-fry strips, brown onion, snow peas, baby corn, and Thai chili jam stir-fry paste.  A simple yet powerful combination of flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of rinsing rice in a sieve under cold running water.
scenes.voice_over: First, rinse 1 1/2 cups of jasmine rice under cold water until the water runs clear. This removes excess starch and helps achieve fluffy rice.

scenes.image_prompt: A pot of boiling water with rice being added and then covered with a lid.
scenes.voice_over: Boil 3 cups of water in a saucepan. Add the rinsed rice, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes. Then, turn off the heat and let it stand, covered, for 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork strips being stir-fried in a hot wok with oil.
scenes.voice_over: While the rice cooks, heat your wok. Stir-fry the pork in batches with 1 teaspoon of oil per batch for about 1 minute each, until browned. Set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Onions and snow peas being stir-fried in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Add the remaining oil to the wok. Stir-fry the onions for 2 minutes, then add the snow peas and stir-fry for another minute.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding the cooked pork, baby corn, and Thai chili jam stir-fry paste to the wok with the vegetables.
scenes.voice_over: Return the pork to the wok. Add the baby corn and Thai chili jam stir-fry paste. Stir-fry for 2 minutes, or until heated through and the sauce coats everything evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: A plate of cooked jasmine rice topped with the pork stir-fry, garnished with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Serve the pork stir-fry hot over the cooked jasmine rice. Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds for an extra touch of flavor.  Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: The finished dish plated alongside suggested pairings like a side salad and a glass of iced tea.
scenes.voice_over: This dish pairs perfectly with a fresh side salad or some steamed vegetables. A glass of iced tea or your favorite beverage complements the meal beautifully.  Enjoy this easy and flavorful pork stir-fry with jasmine rice!

cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, add more chili jam or a pinch of red pepper flakes.
If you don't have a wok, a large skillet can be used instead.
Ensure the pork is cooked thoroughly before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Fried Rice
ingredients: 600g chicken breast fillets, trimmed and thinly sliced
1 brown onion, cut into thin wedges
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine the light soy sauce, sweet chili sauce, and oyster sauce. Set aside.
Step 2: Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until hot. Add 1 tablespoon of peanut oil and swirl to coat.
Step 3: Add half of the chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until browned. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
Step 4: Add another tablespoon of peanut oil to the wok and repeat with the remaining chicken. Transfer the cooked chicken to the plate.
Step 5: Add the remaining 2 teaspoons of peanut oil to the wok. Add the onion and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until softened and golden.
Step 6: Add the crushed garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds, or until fragrant.
Step 7: Add the beaten eggs to the wok and scramble until cooked through. Add the cold cooked rice and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through and combined with the egg.
Step 8: Return the cooked chicken to the wok. Add the soy sauce mixture, Thai basil leaves, and sliced green onions.
Step 9: Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, or until everything is well combined and heated through.
Step 10: Serve the chicken fried rice in bowls and sprinkle with fried shallots.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a dynamic close-up of Chicken Fried Rice, showcasing glistening grains and tender chicken pieces coated in a rich sauce. Use a dark, rustic wooden backdrop and textured ceramic bowls.  Shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on a clump of rice with chicken and basil, blurring the background.  Soft, directional lighting from the side emphasizes texture and creates a warm, inviting mood. Garnish with fresh Thai basil sprigs and chopped peanuts for visual appeal. Consider a slightly overhead angle to reveal the vibrant colors and ingredients.

video_script.title: Easy Chicken Fried Rice

recipes.name: Crispy Fried Idli
ingredients: 5-6 leftover idlis, sliced into 1/2-inch thick planks
Black salt or regular salt, to taste
Fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Slice the idlis: Slice the leftover idlis lengthwise into planks about 1/2-inch thick, similar to french fries but wider.
Step 2: Dust with corn flour: Lightly sprinkle the idli planks with corn flour, ensuring all sides are coated.
Step 3: Heat the oil: Heat 2 cups of vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Step 4: Fry the idlis: Once the oil is hot, carefully add 3-4 idli planks to the pan, avoiding overcrowding. Fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.

Step 5: Drain and season: Remove the fried idli planks from the pan using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil. Season immediately with pav bhaji masala, chaat masala, idli podi (if using), and salt.
Step 6: Garnish and serve: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with your favorite chutneys or dips.

recipes.name: Loaded Cajun Fries with Chorizo
ingredients: 1 large red onion, halved and thinly sliced
2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning, plus a pinch
150g mixed grated cheddar and mozzarella cheese
Small bunch of coriander leaves, picked
directions: Step 1: Combine the sliced red onion, lime juice, and a pinch of salt in a non-metallic bowl. Set aside to lightly pickle for 20 minutes. (Can be prepared up to 5 days in advance and stored chilled.)
Step 2: Preheat oven to 200°C (180°C fan/gas mark 6).

Step 3: Arrange the frozen fries in a single layer on a large baking tray. Sprinkle with a pinch of Cajun seasoning and bake for 10 minutes, shaking the tray halfway through. The fries should be cooked but not browned.

Step 4: While the fries are baking, remove the sausage meat from the casings and place in a frying pan. Add 2 teaspoons of Cajun seasoning. Fry over medium heat, breaking up the meat with a wooden spoon, until cooked through and browned in places.

Step 5: Remove the fries from the oven and scatter the cooked sausage and grated cheese over them. Return to the oven for another 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the fries are golden and crisp.
Step 6: Top the loaded fries with the chopped tomatoes, soured cream, pickled jalapeños, pickled red onions, and coriander leaves just before serving.

recipes.name: Marinated and Pan-Fried Tofu with Vegetables
ingredients: 1 pound extra-firm tofu, drained and cut into 1/2-inch triangles
1 tablespoon peanut oil, or vegetable oil
1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Tofu Marinade: In a bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, extra-virgin olive oil, garlic, sesame oil, sugar, and chili paste. Cover and refrigerate.
Step 2: Dry-Fry the Tofu: Cut the drained tofu into 1/2-inch thick triangles. Dry-fry the tofu in a pan over medium heat until lightly browned.
Step 3: Marinate the Tofu: Place the dry-fried tofu in a large resealable bag. Pour the marinade over the tofu, seal the bag, and refrigerate overnight, turning occasionally.
Step 4: Prepare the Vegetables: Finely chop the onion, slice the mushrooms, and cut the bell pepper into thin strips.
Step 5: Stir-fry the Vegetables and Tofu: Preheat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the peanut or vegetable oil. Add the ginger slices and cook until fragrant.
Step 6: Add the Vegetables: Add the onion and mushrooms to the wok and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add rice wine if needed to prevent drying.
Step 7: Add Bell Pepper and Baby Corn: Add the bell pepper and baby corn. Stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 8: Add Tofu: Add the marinated tofu to the wok. Cook briefly, turning gently, to heat through.

Step 9: Thicken the Sauce: Push the vegetables and tofu to the sides of the wok. Add the reserved marinade to the center and bring to a boil. In a small dish, combine the cornstarch and water. Add the cornstarch mixture to the boiling marinade, stirring quickly to thicken.
Step 10: Combine and Serve: Stir to combine the sauce with the tofu and vegetables. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Tijuana Street Fries with Slow-Cooked Carnitas
ingredients: 1 large or 2 small chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, minced
8 dried guajillo chiles (or a mix of guajillo, ancho, chipotle, and habanero chiles)
3 pounds russet potatoes, peeled (optional) and cut into 1/4-inch to 1/2-inch thick fries
2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, minced
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Carnitas: Combine salt, pepper, smoked paprika, cumin, onion powder, chipotle chili powder, oregano, cayenne pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, and cinnamon in a bowl.
Step 2: Sear the Pork: Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Rub the pork with 1/3 of the seasoning mix. Sear the pork on all sides until golden brown (about 2 minutes per side).

Step 3: Slow Cook the Pork: Place the seared pork in a slow cooker. Sprinkle with the remaining seasoning mix. Add water, tequila (or water), orange juice, honey, and minced chipotle peppers. Cook on low for 8-12 hours, or until tender.
Step 4: Shred the Pork: Shred the pork with forks in the slow cooker. Mix with the cooking liquid. Keep warm.
Step 5: Roast the Tomatillos: Preheat the broiler to high. Place tomatillos on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Broil for 4-5 minutes, or until charred.

Step 6: Toast the Chiles and Garlic: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Toast the garlic cloves (in their skins) and dried chiles in the skillet until fragrant and slightly charred. Peel the garlic.

Step 7: Make the Salsa: Combine the roasted tomatillos, toasted chiles, peeled garlic, and fire-roasted tomatoes in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Add olive oil, honey, salt, and cilantro. Blend again. Refrigerate until ready to use.
Step 8: Prepare the Fries: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Toss the cut potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Step 9: Bake the Fries: Arrange the fries in a single layer on baking sheets. Bake for 20 minutes, then toss and bake for another 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.

Step 10: Make the Queso: Heat half-and-half and cream cheese in a saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth. Add Oaxaca and cheddar cheeses. Stir until melted and smooth. Stir in minced chipotle peppers and cilantro.

Step 11: Assemble the Fries: Divide the fries among plates. Drizzle with queso. Top with carnitas, mashed avocado, sour cream (or Greek yogurt), jalapeño slices, cotija cheese, and cilantro. Drizzle with salsa and more queso.

recipes.name: Crispy Korean Fried Chicken Wings
directions: Step 1: Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels.
Step 2: In a medium bowl, whisk together sherry and 1/2 teaspoon soy sauce. Add chicken wings and toss to coat. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, up to 4 hours.
Step 3: In a shallow bowl, combine cornstarch, baking powder, garlic powder, and onion powder.
Step 4: Heat frying oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot to 350°F (175°C).
Step 5: Fry chicken wings in batches for about 10 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F/74°C).
Step 6: While the chicken wings are frying, prepare the sauce.
Step 7: In a small saucepan, whisk together sesame oil, ketchup, gochujang (or garlic chili paste), honey, brown sugar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, and minced garlic.
Step 8: Cook over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes, or until the sauce thickens, stirring frequently. Alternatively, heat in a microwave-safe bowl in 1-minute increments.
Step 9: Drain the fried chicken wings and keep warm in a 200°F (95°C) oven.
Step 10: Toss the wings in the prepared sauce, garnish with sesame seeds and chopped scallions, and serve immediately.

scenes.voice_over: While the chicken is frying, prepare the sauce. Combine sesame oil, ketchup, gochujang, honey, brown sugar, soy sauce, and minced garlic in a saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes until it thickens, stirring frequently. You can also microwave it in 1-minute increments.

recipes.name: California-Style Indian Fry Bread Tacos
ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) can diced green chilies, drained
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, salt, powdered milk, and baking powder.
Step 2: Pour the water over the dry ingredients all at once and stir with a fork until a shaggy dough forms.
Step 3: Lightly flour your hands and gently mix the dough until it comes together in a ball. Do not knead.
Step 4: Divide the dough into four equal pieces.
Step 5: On a lightly floured surface, shape each piece of dough into a 5-7 inch disk.
Step 6: Heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil in a large Dutch oven or deep skillet to 350°F (175°C).
Step 7: Carefully place one dough disk into the hot oil. Gently press down on the dough to submerge it.
Step 8: Fry for 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown.
Step 9: Remove the fry bread from the oil and place it on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain. Keep warm in a 200°F (95°C) oven while you fry the remaining bread.
Step 10: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground beef and diced onion. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 11: To assemble the tacos, place each fry bread on a plate.
Step 12: Layer the ground beef mixture, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and drained green chilies on top of each fry bread.
Step 13: Serve with sour cream, if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture California-style Indian Fry Bread Tacos with studio lighting, highlighting the golden, textured fry bread cradling seasoned ground beef and crisp lettuce.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the taco filling, with a slightly blurred background of weathered wood and colorful serape fabric. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh cilantro and a lime wedge. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the taco's layered components and creating a vibrant, inviting mood.

scenes.voice_over: Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl. Add the water all at once and stir with a fork until a shaggy dough forms. Gently mix with your hands until it comes together. Don't overknead!

scenes.voice_over: Divide the dough into four equal pieces. Shape each piece into a 5-7 inch disk on a lightly floured surface.

scenes.voice_over: Heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil in a large skillet to 350°F (175°C). Carefully place one dough disk into the hot oil and gently press down to submerge. Fry for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ground beef and onion cooking in a skillet.
scenes.voice_over: While the bread is frying, brown 1 pound of ground beef with 1 cup of diced onion in a separate skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

scenes.voice_over: Serve with a dollop of sour cream, if desired. Enjoy your California-style Indian Fry Bread Tacos! Each serving has approximately 500-600 calories, 25-30 grams of protein, 50-60 grams of carbs, and 25-30 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: To test if the oil is hot enough, drop a small piece of dough into the oil. It should sizzle and float to the surface quickly.
Don't overcrowd the pan when frying the bread. Fry in batches to ensure even cooking.
Fry bread can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and reheated in a 350°F (175°C) oven for 10-15 minutes.

recipes.name: Malaysian Pork Stir-Fry with Rice Noodles
ingredients: 2 large brown onions, cut into wedges
2 long red chilies, deseeded and thinly sliced
1 bunch baby bok choy, leaves separated, stems sliced
directions: Step 1: Cook the rice noodles according to package directions.
Step 2: Drain the noodles and set aside.
Step 3: Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat until hot.
Step 4: Add 2 teaspoons of peanut oil and swirl to coat.
Step 5: Add one-third of the pork strips and stir-fry for 2 minutes, or until browned and sealed.
Step 6: Remove the pork from the wok and set aside on a plate.
Step 7: Repeat steps 4-6 with the remaining pork in two batches.
Step 8: Add the remaining peanut oil to the wok.
Step 9: Add the onions and stir-fry for 2 minutes, or until softened.
Step 10: Add the chilies and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 11: Return the cooked pork and any accumulated juices to the wok.
Step 12: Add the bok choy stems and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 13: In a small bowl, combine the lime juice, kecap manis, and sugar.
Step 14: Pour the sauce over the pork and vegetables in the wok and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 15: Add the bok choy leaves and stir to combine.
Step 16: Spoon the stir-fry over the cooked noodles.
Step 17: Serve immediately with lime wedges.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, overhead shot of Malaysian Pork Stir-Fry with glistening rice noodles, nestled amongst tender bok choy and caramelized onion wedges. Use a dark, textured background to contrast the vibrant colors.  Highlight the glistening textures of the noodles and pork with soft, directional lighting. A shallow depth of field should focus on the pork, with a subtle bokeh effect on the surrounding elements. Include a scattering of sliced chilies and lime wedges as garnish.  The mood should be warm, inviting, and appetizing.

If you don't have a wok, a large skillet or frying pan can be used instead.

recipes.name: Crispy Ebi Fry with Homemade Tartar Sauce
directions: Step 1: Prepare the shrimp: Peel and devein the shrimp, leaving the tails intact. Make a few shallow incisions on the underside of each shrimp and gently flatten them to prevent curling during cooking. Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels.
Step 2: Set up breading stations: Arrange three shallow dishes. In the first, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. In the second, place the beaten egg. In the third, place the panko breadcrumbs.
Step 3: Bread the shrimp: Dredge each shrimp in the seasoned flour, then dip in the beaten egg, ensuring it's fully coated. Finally, coat thoroughly with panko breadcrumbs.

Step 4: Fry the shrimp: Heat canola oil in a deep pan to 340-360°F (170-180°C). Carefully place the breaded shrimp in the hot oil and fry until golden brown and cooked through, turning once. This should take about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
Step 5: Make the tartar sauce: In a small bowl, combine the chopped hard-boiled egg, minced onion, minced pickles, and mayonnaise. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 6: Assemble and serve: Arrange the ebi fry on a serving plate. Serve immediately with the tartar sauce and optional shredded cabbage.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy golden-brown Ebi Fry, tails elegantly curled, arranged on a dark slate board with a small ramekin of creamy tartar sauce.  Use a slightly overhead angle, highlighting the panko texture.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the closest shrimp. Soft, diffused natural light from the side creates enticing highlights. Garnish with a lemon wedge and fresh dill sprig.  Background should be dark and moody, emphasizing the vibrant colors of the dish. Aim for a sophisticated and appetizing mood.

video_script.title: Crispy Ebi Fry with Homemade Tartar Sauce

scenes.voice_over: While the shrimp drain, let's make the tartar sauce. Combine the chopped hard-boiled egg, minced onion, minced pickles, and mayonnaise. Season with salt and pepper.

cooking_tips: For extra crispy ebi fry, you can double bread the shrimp by dipping them in the egg and panko a second time.

recipes.name: Crispy Tofu and Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 tablespoon finely chopped purple or white onion
Fresh chili pepper slices or chili flakes (optional)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Tofu Marinade: In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons of hoisin sauce and the brown sugar until the sugar dissolves. Add the cubed tofu to the marinade, gently turning to coat. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes.
Step 2: Make the Stir-Fry Sauce: In a separate bowl, combine the vegetable stock, soy sauce, sweet chili sauce, 1 tablespoon of hoisin sauce, sherry, and rice vinegar. Set aside.
Step 3: Coat and Fry the Tofu: Spread the flour on a large plate. Remove the tofu from the marinade and gently toss each piece in the flour until evenly coated.

Step 4: Heat 5 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the floured tofu and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy. Remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside on a paper towel-lined plate.

Step 5: Stir-fry the Vegetables: Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil to the same skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant. Add the carrot and celery and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Step 6: Add the broccoli and mushrooms and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.  Add a few tablespoons of the stir-fry sauce to the vegetables.
Step 7: Add the bok choy and red bell pepper. Continue stir-frying for 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender-crisp, adding more stir-fry sauce as needed.
Step 8: Return the tofu to the skillet and toss with the vegetables and remaining sauce.  Adjust seasonings as needed with lemon or lime juice, soy sauce, or chili flakes.
Step 9: Serve the stir-fry hot over cooked jasmine rice. Garnish with fresh chili slices (if desired).

Use shallow depth of field to blur the colorful vegetables in the background.  Employ moody, directional lighting to create dramatic shadows and enhance the glossiness of the sauce.  Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds for visual appeal.  Incorporate chopsticks and a linen napkin for context.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Noodles with Vegetables
ingredients: 5-8 ounces Chinese-style wheat noodles or egg noodles
1/4 cup shallots or purple onion, coarsely chopped
1 small head broccoli, cut into florets
1 small red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
Fresh basil or cilantro, for garnish
3 tablespoons rice vinegar or white wine vinegar
1/2-3/4 teaspoon dried crushed chili, chili flakes, or fresh minced red chili
directions: Step 1: Cook the noodles according to package directions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside.
Step 2: In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice vinegar or white wine vinegar, fish sauce, sugar, white pepper, and chili.
Step 3: Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat.
Step 4: Add the garlic, galangal or ginger, and shallots or purple onion and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 5: Add the carrots and 1-2 tablespoons of the sauce. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Step 6: Add the mushrooms, broccoli, and red bell pepper, along with 3-4 more tablespoons of the sauce. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Step 7: Add the noodles and the remaining sauce to the pan. Toss to combine.
Step 8: Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, or until the noodles are heated through and the vegetables are tender-crisp.
Step 9: During the last minute of cooking, add the bean sprouts and stir-fry until wilted.
Step 10: Taste and adjust seasonings as needed, adding more fish sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, sugar, or chili to taste.
Step 11: Garnish with fresh basil or cilantro and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Spicy Pork Stir-Fry with Broccolini and Gai Lan
ingredients: 1 red onion, cut into thin wedges
1 bunch gai lan (Chinese broccoli), stems cut into 3cm lengths, leaves coarsely chopped
directions: Step 1: Heat a large wok or non-stick frying pan over high heat.
Step 2: Spray with olive oil.
Step 3: Stir-fry one-third of the pork for 2-3 minutes or until golden. Transfer to a plate.
Step 4: Repeat step 3, in 2 more batches, with the remaining pork.
Step 5: Spray the wok with olive oil.
Step 6: Stir-fry the onion for 2 minutes or until softened.
Step 7: Add the curry paste and stir-fry for 1 minute or until aromatic.
Step 8: Add the broccolini, gai lan stems, and water. Stir-fry for 1 minute.
Step 9: Add the gai lan leaves and stir-fry for 2 minutes or until the leaves just wilt.
Step 10: In a small bowl, combine the lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar until the sugar dissolves.
Step 11: Add the pork and the lime juice mixture to the wok.
Step 12: Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until heated through and combined.
Step 13: Remove from heat and toss through the basil.
Step 14: Serve the stir-fry over steamed rice and top with cashews.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork slices being stir-fried in a wok over high heat. The pork is golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add a tablespoon of olive oil and stir-fry the pork in batches until golden brown. This ensures a tender and juicy result. Set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Red onion wedges being stir-fried in the wok. They are slightly translucent.
scenes.voice_over: Add a little more oil to the wok and sauté the red onion until softened. This adds a touch of sweetness to our stir-fry.

scenes.image_prompt: Red curry paste being added to the wok with the onions. The paste is fragrant and vibrant red.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add a tablespoon of red curry paste. Stir-fry for about a minute until fragrant. This is where the magic happens!

scenes.image_prompt: Broccolini and gai lan stems being added to the wok. They are bright green.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the broccolini and gai lan stems with a splash of water. Stir-fry for another minute.

scenes.image_prompt: Gai lan leaves being added to the wok. They are wilting slightly.
scenes.voice_over: Toss in the gai lan leaves and stir-fry until they just wilt. We want to retain their vibrant color and nutrients.

scenes.image_prompt: A small bowl containing lime juice, fish sauce, and brown sugar being whisked together.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine lime juice, fish sauce, and brown sugar for a tangy and savory sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked pork being returned to the wok with the vegetables and sauce. Everything is being tossed together.
scenes.voice_over: Return the pork to the wok, along with the sauce. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through.

scenes.image_prompt: Fresh basil leaves being tossed into the stir-fry. The leaves are vibrant green.
scenes.voice_over: Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil for an aromatic finish.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished spicy pork stir-fry served over steamed rice and garnished with chopped toasted cashews and a sprig of basil. A close-up shot shows the vibrant colors and textures of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your spicy pork stir-fry over steamed rice and garnish with toasted cashews. Each serving has approximately 500 calories, 30 grams of protein, 40 grams of carbs, and 25 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a spicier stir-fry, add more red curry paste.
If you don't have gai lan, you can substitute with regular broccoli.
Serve with a side of sriracha for extra heat.
